a.span: Middle and High School Continuity of Education

div.h1: Sullivan County School District Response to Covid-19 School Closure

span.p: On Friday March 13th, Governor Wolf responded to the Covid-19 Pandemic by shutting schools down throughout the Commonwealth.Â Schools are closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year.

The closure of schools throughout the state and for such an extended period of time is unprecedented, and the Sullivan County School District is working to create resources for families that can help them through this time.Â While there is a focus on learning, the school district is just as, if not more, focused on essential needs of families.Â Use this section of our website to find out updated information regarding the school's response.

Due to COVID-19 and the Governorâs âstay at homeâ order, all offices are closed and only essential personnel are reporting to work with restricted hours. All phone calls are being directed to the district office and checked periodically. Please leave a message including contact information and a school personnel member will be in contact with you. If you have a concern and/or question, you may email the Administrator you wish to address with the information.Â Emails for Administrators can found by clicking here. Be safe and stay healthy!
